replies.bodyText:
We use it for highlight rules here:

  
    
      rstudio/src/gwt/acesupport/acemode/rmarkdown_highlight_rules.js
    
    
        Lines 156 to 164
      in
      3e709a0
    
    
    
    

        
          
           // Embed YAML highlighting rules 
        

        
          
           Utils.embedRules( 
        

        
          
              this, 
        

        
          
              YamlHighlightRules, 
        

        
          
              "yaml", 
        

        
          
              "^\\s*---\\s*$", 
        

        
          
              "^\\s*(?:---|\\.\\.\\.)\\s*$", 
        

        
          
              ["firstLine"] 
        

        
          
           ); 
        
    
  


And we have a similar version here:

  
    
      rstudio/src/cpp/core/YamlUtil.cpp
    
    
        Lines 32 to 36
      in
      3e709a0
    
    
    
    

        
          
           const boost::regex& reYaml() 
        

        
          
           { 
        

        
          
              static boost::regex instance("^[\\s\\n]*---\\s*(.*?)---\\s*(?:$|\\n)"); 
        

        
          
              return instance; 
        

        
          
           } 
        
    
  


The Pandoc spec says:

A YAML metadata block is a valid YAML object, delimited by a line of three hyphens (---) at the top and a line of three hyphens (---) or three dots (...) at the bottom.

So, strictly speaking, the second version is wrong, and so is the version in this PR -- although in practice, users almost always use ---.
